paper_abstract: Let R and B be two sets of points such that the points of R are colored red and the points of B are colored blue. Let P be a path such that vertical bar R vertical bar vertices of P are red and vertical bar B vertical bar vertices of P are blue. We study the problem of computing a crossing-free drawing of P such that each blue vertex is represented as a point of B and each red vertex of P is represented as a point of R. We show that such a drawing can always be realized by using at most one bend per edge.
paper_title: How to embed a path onto two sets of points
